Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Interface ConfigurationSerializer

public interface ConfigurationSerializer
This interface can be implemented to serialize editor configurations to various formats. The interface expects that the implementation backs a collection of settings as if by a Map. When a configuration is serialized, settings will be written to the serializer implementation as key, value pairs. When it is deserialized, settings will be queried by looking up keys and decoding the returned values. Missing keys will be filled in with suitable defaults.

Note that the serializer does not store or load the input handler configuration.

Since:
3.0

  • Method Details

    • put

      void put​(String key, String value)
      Stores a configuration feature with the specified key and value. When deserializing, the feature will be fetched by calling get(java.lang.String) using the same key.
      Parameters:
      key - the key that identifies the feature
      value - the value to store for the feature

    • get

      String get​(String key)
      Returns the previously stored value of a feature key. If a key is requested for which no value was stored, this method must return null.
      Parameters:
      key - the key that identifies the feature; never null
      Returns:
      the value that was stored for the key, or null
